trans-unit.source: Indicates the progress of an operation.
A <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar> control consists of a window that is filled, by default from left to right, as an operation progresses.
The control has a range and a current position.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar> overrides the metadata of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Maximum%2A> property and sets its default to 100.
<xref:System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar> overrides the metadata of the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.Focusable%2A> property and sets its default to `false`.
For more information, see [Dependency Properties Overview](~/docs/framework/wpf/advanced/dependency-properties-overview.md).
Customizing the ProgressBar Control
To apply the same property settings to multiple <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar> controls, use the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Style%2A> property.
You can modify the default <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate> to give the control a unique appearance.

For more information about creating a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ControlTemplate>, see [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).

To see the parts and states that are specific to the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar>, see [ProgressBar Styles and Templates](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/progressbar-styles-and-templates.md).
Dependency properties for this control might be set by the controlâ€™s default style.
If a property is set by a default style, the property might change from its default value when the control appears in the application.
The default style is determined by which desktop theme is used when the application is running.
For more information, see [Default WPF Themes](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=158252).
Setting a visual property will only have an effect if that property is both present in <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar> control's default template and is set by using a .

You can find a list of visual properties in the "Changing the Visual Structure of a Control" section in [Customizing the Appearance of an Existing Control by Creating a ControlTemplate](~/docs/framework/wpf/controls/customizing-the-appearance-of-an-existing-control.md).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar"></xref> class.
Gets or sets whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar"></xref> shows actual values or generic, continuous progress feedback.

When this property is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar> animates a few bars moving across the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar> in a continuous manner and ignores the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value%2A> property.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
`false` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar"></xref> shows actual values; `true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar"></xref> shows generic progress.
The default is `false`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar.IsIndeterminate"></xref> dependency property.
Called when a template is applied to a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar"></xref>.

Provides an appropriate <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ProgressBarAutomationPeer"></xref> implementation for this control, as part of the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_winclient](~/includes/tla2sharptla-winclient-md.md)] automation infrastructure.
The type-specific <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> implementation.
Updates the current position of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Maximum"></xref> property changes.
Old value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Maximum"></xref> property.
New value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Maximum"></xref> property.
Updates the current position of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Minimum"></xref> property changes.
Old value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Minimum"></xref> property.
New value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Minimum"></xref> property.
Updates the current position of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value"></xref> property changes.
Old value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value"></xref> property.
New value of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Primitives.RangeBase.Value"></xref> property.
Gets or sets the orientation of a <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar"></xref>: horizontal or vertical.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Orientation"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Orientation.Horizontal"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.ProgressBar.Orientation"></xref> dependency property.
